## Presentations

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/brands/youtube.svg" height="20"/> [Openscapes approach to helping organizations transition to Open Science workflows and new tools](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TuqgE2jc2ZQ) Presented to the High-level Group for the Modernisation of Statistical Production & Services (HLG-MOS), United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE). May 4, 2022: Lowndes and Holmes.

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/brands/youtube.svg" height="20"/> [Open Science Adoption with Organizations: Lessons for individuals from theories about technology adoption](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hbFAkhNRpJw) Dr. Eli Holmes gave a talk on using theory concerning technology adoption to help plan activities for the Year of Open Science. ESIP Panel on "Better Science for Future Us: Planning for the Year of Open Science" organized by Erin Robinson and Julie Lowndes. January 18-21, 2022.

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/brands/youtube.svg" height="20"/> [VRData R Package](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XNiwuEJvMno&t=1s) Dr. Eli Holmes (NWFSC) describes and screenshares her team's open science practices (GitHub, R) that increase efficiency, quality control, and transparency for Pacific Northwest Salmonid Viability Reports. December 1, 2021.

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/brands/youtube.svg" height="20"/> [Data to Product Workflows](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-w_74Pc908) Em Markowitz (NOAA Alaska Fisheries Science Center) presented during the NMFS Openscapes Champions Cohort about her R package for automating reports for NOAA with RMarkdown. October 1, 2021.

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/6.x/svgs/regular/file-powerpoint.svg" height="20"/> [State of the Ecosystem Product Development Workflow](https://noaa-edab.github.io/presentations/20211015_Openscapes_Bastille.html#1) Kim Bastille (NOAA Northeast Fisheries Science Center) presented during the FDD Openscapes Champions Cohort about the reproducible workflow used by the State Of the Ecosystem report.
